FuzzyNetwork¶

class FuzzyNetwork(groupset: hotfis.membership.fuzzygroupset.FuzzyGroupset)¶

Bases: object

A hierarchical network of fuzzy inference systems.

roots¶

Root nodes that give final output.

Type

Dict[str, _FuzzyNode]

node_names¶

Set of all node names in network.

Type

Set[str]

input_names¶

Set of input node and group names.

Type

Set[Tuple[str, str]

output_names¶

Set of output node and group names.

Type

Set[Tuple[str, str]

__getitem__(node_name)¶

Supports subscripting for node retrieval (ex. network[“node_name”]).

static defuzz_mamdani(domain: numpy.ndarray, codomain: numpy.ndarray) → ArrayLike¶

Defuzzifies Mamdani output and returns scalar value(s).

Parameters

  • domain – Domain of Mamdani output.

  • codomain – Output memberships corresponding to domain.

Returns

Defuzzified output(s).

display() → None¶

Prints a network’s nodes with inputs and outputs.

eval_mamdani(inputs: typing.Dict[str, <sphinx.util.inspect.TypeAliasForwardRef object at 0x0000024D2C377CD0>], return_all: bool = False, num_points: int = 100) → Dict[str, Dict[str, Tuple[numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray]]]¶

Evaluates the entire network and returns MamdaniFunctions. Will return every node’s output if return_all is given as True.

eval_membership(inputs: typing.Dict[str, <sphinx.util.inspect.TypeAliasForwardRef object at 0x0000024D2C3776D0>], return_all: bool = False, use_tsk: bool = True, num_points: int = 100) → Dict[str, Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]]¶

Evaluates the entire network and returns memberships to all functions. Will return every node’s output if return_all is given as True.

Uses either Takagi-Sugeno or Mamdani inference for evaluation needed for subsequent nodes based on whether the use_tsk parameter is True.

eval_tsk(inputs: typing.Dict[str, <sphinx.util.inspect.TypeAliasForwardRef object at 0x0000024D2C3869D0>], return_all: bool = False) → Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]¶

Evaluates the entire network and returns defuzzified Takagi-Sugeno output. Will return every node’s output if return_all is given as True.

insert(new_roots: Dict[str, hotfis.rules.fuzzyruleset.FuzzyRuleset])¶

Inserts one or more rulesets as FISNodes as roots in network.

static plot_mamdani(domain: numpy.ndarray, codomain: numpy.ndarray)¶

Plots output of Mamdani inference.

Can be used in conjunction with an output membership function group’s plot method to visualize both the group and inference output.

Parameters

  • domain – Domain values of output as returned by Mamdani eval.

  • codomain – Output membership values as returned by Mamdani eval.

req_inputs() → Set[Tuple[str, str]]¶

Returns a set of tuples indicating the node name and input name of ONLY the inputs required from the user for evaluation.

Example

network.req_inputs() -> {(offence, x), (thrust_dir, x), (defense, y))}

This means the offence and thrust_dir nodes need a value for x and defense needs a value for y.

outputs = network.eval_tsk({x: x_val, y: y_val}, groupset)
